translations.translation: Equal are not the blind and those who can see,
The blind and the seeing are not alike,
The blind and the seeing are not alike
And the blind and the sighted are not equal!
Not alike are the blind and the seeing.
And the blind and the seeing are not alike
Not equal are the blind and the seeing man,
The blind man is not equal with the seer;
The blind and the sighted are not equal,
Not alike are the blind and the seeing.
The blind one and the seer are not equal,
The blind and the seeing are not alike;
Not alike are the blind (disbelievers in Islamic Monotheism) and the seeing (believers in Islamic Monotheism).
The blind and the seeing are not equal,
Not equal are the blind and the seeing.
Not equal are the blind and the seeing,
[35:19] Nor are the blind and the seer equal, that is, the disbeliever and the believer [are not equal],
(The blind man) the disbeliever (is not equal with the seer) the believer;

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { وَمَا يَسْتَوِي ٱلأَعْمَىٰ } معناه الكافرُ { وَٱلْبَصِيرُ } معناه المؤمنُ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَ } لكن { مَا يَسْتَوِي } في القرب والرتبة بالنسبة إليه سبحانه { ٱلأَعْمَىٰ } الغافل الجاهل عن كيفية الرجوع والتوجه { وَٱلْبَصِيرُ } [فاطر: 19] العارف العالم بأمارات الصعود والعروج

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
يقول الحق جلّ جلاله: { وما يستوي الأعمى والبصيرُ } أي: لا يستوي الكافر والمؤمن، أو الجاهل والعالم
 وقيل: هما مثلان للصنم والله تعالى
